line.token: * This file is part of the Symfony package.
* For the full copyright and license information, please view the LICENSE
* file that was distributed with this source code.
* A console command that creates users and stores them in the database.
* To use this command, open a terminal window, enter into your project
* To output detailed information, increase the command verbosity:
* For more advanced uses, commands can be defined as services too. See
// to make your command lazily loaded, configure the $defaultName static property,
// so it will be instantiated only when the command is actually called.
'Creates users and stores them in the database'
// commands can optionally define arguments and/or options (mandatory and optional)
'The plain password of the new user'
'The full name of the new user'
'If set, the user is created as an administrator'
* This optional method is the first one executed for a command after configure()
* and is useful to initialize properties based on the input arguments and options.
// SymfonyStyle is an optional feature that Symfony provides so you can
// apply a consistent look to the commands of your application.
* This method is executed after initialize() and before execute(). Its purpose
* is to check if some of the options/arguments are missing and interactively
* ask the user for those values.
* This method is completely optional. If you are developing an internal console
* command, you probably should not implement this method because it requires
* quite a lot of work. However, if the command is meant to be used by external
* users, this method is a nice way to fall back and prevent errors.
'If you prefer to not use this interactive wizard, provide the'
'arguments required by this command as follows:'
' $ php bin/console app:add-user username password email@example.com'
'Now we\'ll ask you for the value of all the missing command arguments.'
// Ask for the username if it's not defined
// Ask for the password if it's not defined
// Ask for the email if it's not defined
// Ask for the full name if it's not defined
* This method is executed after interact() and initialize(). It usually
* contains the logic to execute to complete this command task.
// make sure to validate the user data is correct
// create the user and encode its password
'New user database id: %d / Elapsed time: %.2f ms / Consumed memory: %.2f MB'
// first check if a user with the same username already exists.
'There is already a user registered with the "%s" username.'
// validate password and email if is not this input means interactive.
// check if a user with the same email already exists.
'There is already a user registered with the "%s" email.'
* The command help is usually included in the configure() method, but when
* it's too long, it's better to define a separate method to maintain the
The <info>%command.name%</info> command creates new users and saves them in the database:
By default the command creates regular users. To create administrator users,
If you omit any of the three required arguments, the command will ask you to
# command will ask you for the email
# command will ask you for the email and password
# command will ask you for all arguments
